result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Emmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 2/02/2015: Court grants 100 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed; inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on the premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns, or liquor stores)
Provide DNA Sample if not already done.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael B Emmer in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not complete drug treatment court. Court enters judgment of conviction on Ct. 1 and parties proceed to sentencing. Deft.'s mother made statements. Credit to be submitted to the court by 01/29/2015. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 2 months (Initial Confinement: 14 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety and Random U.A.'s. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only  in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all Rx.. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.  No presence on any premises whose primary businesss is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Sentencing hearing on January 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant discharged from DTC
